page.title: 03Sutton Poyntz 1
page.content: Sutton Poyntz was mentioned in the original Domesday Book as Sutone. Sheltered by hills to the North,East and West,blessed by a benign climate and a perpetual water supply from underground springs,there is ample evidence that {Sutton Poyntz}has been treasured as a residential area since the Iron Age.Today's residents represent accountancy,the army,atomic energy,banking building catering,chemists,dentistry,doctors,en gineers,hairdressing,the health services,local authorities,manufacturers,the navy,the oil industry,pilots,printing,teachers and other miscellaneous services. The middle of the village is occupied by the village pond,which has been dated as far back as 1780 and today forms a delightful centrepiece.
